description: Palindromes whose square is a palindrome; also palindromes whose sum of squares of digits is less than 10.
comments: Needs longer b-file - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 18 2015.
links: R. J. Mathar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..412
P. De Geest, Subsets of Palindromic Squares
example: 121 is OK since 121^2=14641 is also a palindrome.
mathematica: PalQ[n_] := FromDigits[Reverse[IntegerDigits[n]]] == n; t = {}; Do[If[PalQ[n] && PalQ[n^2], AppendTo[t, n]], {n, 0, 1200000}]; t (* _Jayanta Basu_, May 10 2013 *)
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Aug 12 2000
